Definition:  Special Allowance Payable Under Section 156 of Public Law 97-377
The
special allowance
payable under Section 156 of
Public Law (PL) 97-377
is called the Restored Entitlement Program for Survivors (REPS).  The REPS allowance is a payment to certain surviving spouses and children of individuals who died
on active duty prior to August 13, 1981, or
as a result of an SC disability that was incurred or aggravated prior to August 13, 1981.
Reference
:  For more information on the special allowance payable under Section 156 of
PL 97-377
, see
M21-1, Part XII, Subpart ii, 3
, and
38 CFR 3.812
.
